comment.author: 24492310@N00
comment._content: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9807E6D7173EE0... My sleuthing indicates that this is the funeral service of Henry Huttleston Rogers, an important early businessman. He died in New York City but was entombed in Fairhaven, MA. I am not sure if this photo is in front of a church in New York City or Massachusetts. He seems to be NYC, but I can't confirm it.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
cyntata2672:

Thanks for the "sleuthing." We'll look into it.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: H. H. Rogers was a Unitarian. His funeral in May, 1909, was held in Manhattan, at the Unitarian Church of the Messiah, at 34th Street and Park Avenue, where he had been a member for many years.  In 1919, the church changed its name to Community Church. Rogers was buried in Fairhaven, Massachusetts.
